       accept-line (^J ^M) (^J ^M) (^J ^M)
              Finish editing the buffer.  Normally, this will accept the line
              and execute it.

       accept-line-and-down-history (^O) (unbound) (unbound)
              Execute the current line, and push the next history event on the
              editing buffer stack.

       backward-char (^B) (unbound) (^B)
              Move backward one character.

       backward-delete-char (^H ^?) (unbound) (unbound)
              Delete the character behind the cursor.

       backward-kill-line (^U) (unbound) (unbound)
              Kill from the beginning of the line to the cursor position.

       backward-kill-word (^[^H ^[^?) (unbound) (unbound)
              Kill the word behind the cursor.

       backward-word (^[B ^[b) (B) (^[B ^[b)
              Move to the beginning of the previous word.

       beginning-of-line (^A) (unbound) (unbound)
              Move to the beginning of the line.  If already at the beginning
              of the line, move to the beginning of the previous line, if any.

       capitalize-word (^[C ^[c) (unbound) (unbound)
              Capitalize the current word and move past it.

       clear-screen (^L) (unbound) (unbound)
              Clear the screen leaving the current line at the top of the
              screen.  On terminals without termcap, the terminal is cleared.

       copy-region-as-kill (^[W ^[w) (unbound) (unbound)
              Copy the area from the cursor to the mark to the kill buffer.

       delete-char (unbound) (x) (unbound)
              Delete the character under the cursor.

       delete-char-or-list (^D) (unbound) (unbound)
              Delete the character under the cursor, or, if the cursor is at
              the end of the line, list possible completions for the current
              word.

       down-case-word (^[L ^[l) (unbound) (unbound)
              Convert the current word to lowercase and move past it.

       down-line-or-history (^N) (j) (^N)
              Move down a line in the buffer, or if already at the bottom
              line, move to the next event in the history list.

       edit-command-line (^X^E) (unbound) (unbound)
              Invoke an editor on the current command line.

       end-of-line (^E) (unbound) (unbound)
              Move to the end of the line.  If already at the end of the line,
              move to the end of the next line, if any.

       expand-or-complete (^I) (unbound) (^I)
              Attempt shell expansion on the current word.

       forward-char (^F) (unbound) (^F)
              Move forward one character.

       forward-word (^[F ^[f) (W) (^[F ^[f)
              Move to the beginning of the next word.

       get-line (^[G ^[g) (unbound) (unbound)
              Pop the top line off the buffer stack and insert it at the cur‐
              sor position.

       history-incremental-search-backward (^R) (unbound) (unbound)
              Search backward incrementally for a specified string.

       history-search-backward (^[P ^[p) (unbound) (unbound)
              Search backward in the history for a line beginning with the
              first word in the buffer.

       history-search-forward (^[N ^[n) (unbound) (unbound)
              Search forward in the history for a line beginning with the
              first word in the buffer.

       insert-last-word (^[. ^[_) (unbound) (unbound)
              Insert the last word from the previous history event at the cur‐
              sor position.

       kill-line (^K) (unbound) (unbound)
              Kill from the cursor to the end of the line.

       kill-word (^[D ^[d) (unbound) (unbound)
              Kill from the cursor to the end of the current word, or, if
              between words, to the end of the next word.

       push-line (^Q ^[Q ^[q) (unbound) (unbound)
              Push the contents of the buffer on the buffer stack and clear
              the buffer.

       quoted-insert (^V) (unbound) (^V)
              Insert the next character typed literally into the command line.

       run-help (^[H ^[h) (unbound) (unbound)
              Push the buffer onto the buffer stack, and execute the command
              "run-help cmd", where cmd is the current command.

       self-insert
              Insert a character into the buffer at the cursor position.

       send-break (^G ^[^G) (unbound) (unbound)
              Abort the current editor function, e.g., incremental-search-
              backward.

       set-mark-command (^@ ^[ ) (unbound) (unbound)
              Set the mark at the cursor position.

       spell-word (^[S ^[s) (unbound) (unbound)
              Attempt spelling correction on the current word.

       transpose-chars (^T) (unbound) (unbound)
              Exchange the two characters to the left of the cursor, or, if
              the cursor is at the end of the line, the two characters to the
              left of the cursor.

       transpose-words (^[T ^[t) (unbound) (unbound)
              Exchange the current word with the one before it.

       undo (^_ ^Xu ^[z) (u) (unbound)
              Incrementally undo the last text modification.

       up-case-word (^[U ^[u) (unbound) (unbound)
              Convert the current word to uppercase and move past it.

       up-line-or-history (^P) (k -) (^P)
              Move up a line in the buffer, or if already at the top line,
              move to the previous event in the history list.

       yank (^Y) (unbound) (unbound)
              Insert the contents of the kill buffer at the cursor position.

       yank-pop (^[Y ^[y) (unbound) (unbound)
              Remove the text just yanked, rotate the kill-ring, and yank the
              new top.
